nodes.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too Low)
nodes.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too low, causing the nozzle to be too close to the print bed for the first layer.

nodes.name: First Layer Transparent/Thin
nodes.description: The initial layer of the print is see-through or significantly thinner than expected due to excessive squish.

nodes.name: Extrusion Too Wide
nodes.description: Deposited plastic lines on the first layer are significantly wider than the configured extrusion width, spreading out excessively.

nodes.name: Nozzle Scratching Sound
nodes.description: An audible scratching noise occurs as the nozzle travels across the print bed or previous layers, indicating it is too close.

nodes.name: Nozzle Blockage (Partial)
nodes.description: Flow of filament through the nozzle is restricted but not completely stopped, often caused by debris or heat creep.

nodes.name: Poor Inter-Layer Adhesion/Gaps
nodes.description: Layers above the first do not bond well together, potentially showing gaps between them or being easily separated.

nodes.name: No Extrusion
nodes.description: No filament is extruded from the nozzle despite the extruder motor attempting to push filament.

nodes.name: Nozzle Blockage (Complete)
nodes.description: Flow of filament through the nozzle is entirely prevented.

nodes.name: Curved/Inconsistent Extrusion
nodes.description: Filament extruded freely in mid-air comes out crooked, curled, or unevenly instead of falling straight down, often indicating a partial blockage.

nodes.name: Extruded Diameter Mismatch
nodes.description: The diameter of the filament extruded in mid-air appears inconsistent or does not match the expected nozzle diameter.

nodes.name: Extruder Clicking/Skipping
nodes.description: Audible clicking or thumping sounds from the extruder motor, indicating it is struggling and failing to push filament consistently, often due to excessive resistance.

nodes.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too High)
nodes.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too high, causing the nozzle to be too far from the print bed for the first layer.

nodes.name: First Layer Rounded/Rope-like
nodes.description: The initial layer's extruded lines are rounded on top, resembling ropes, instead of being squished flat against the bed.

nodes.name: Poor Bed Adhesion
nodes.description: The first layer does not stick properly to the print surface, potentially detaching completely or being easily knocked loose.

nodes.name: Gaps Between First Layer Lines
nodes.description: Noticeable spaces exist between adjacent lines on the first layer because they are not squished together sufficiently.

nodes.name: Printed Lines Thin (Insufficient Squish)
nodes.description: Extruded lines appear narrow or do not merge properly side-by-side due to insufficient squish from the nozzle being too far.

nodes.name: Print Warping/Detaching
nodes.description: The print lifts off the print bed at the corners or edges, or detaches completely during the printing process, often due to poor first layer adhesion or thermal stress.

nodes.name: Contaminated Print Surface
nodes.description: The print bed surface is dirty (e.g., dust, oil, fingerprints), preventing proper filament adhesion.

nodes.name: Incorrect Bed Leveling
nodes.description: The print bed is not uniformly level or trammed relative to the nozzle's travel plane, causing inconsistent first layer height.

nodes.name: Incorrect Bed Temperature
nodes.description: The print bed temperature is set incorrectly (too low or too high) for the specific filament type, negatively affecting first layer adhesion.

nodes.name: Bed Temperature
nodes.description: Measured temperature of the print bed surface.

nodes.name: Extruder Mechanical Failure
nodes.description: A malfunction within the extruder mechanism (e.g., worn or damaged gear, incorrect idler tension, stepper motor fault) preventing consistent filament feeding, potentially causing clicking or skipping sounds.

nodes.name: Heat Creep
nodes.description: Filament softening or melting prematurely in the cold end or heat break due to excessive heat transfer from the hot end, causing jams, difficult extrusion, or partial blockages.

nodes.name: Incorrect Filament Diameter
nodes.description: The filament being used has a diameter that is inconsistent or significantly deviates from the expected standard (e.g., 1.75mm, 2.85mm), causing feeding issues, jams, or inconsistent extrusion.

nodes.name: Worn Nozzle
nodes.description: The nozzle orifice has become enlarged or deformed through use, leading to inconsistent extrusion width, poor print quality, stringing, or symptoms resembling partial blockage.

nodes.name: Incorrect Extrusion Multiplier/Flow Rate
nodes.description: The slicer setting controlling the overall amount of plastic extruded is miscalibrated (too high or too low), leading to symptoms like over-extrusion (transparent/thin first layer, wide lines) or under-extrusion (gaps, thin lines, poor adhesion).

source.name: First Layer Transparent/Thin
source.description: The initial layer of the print is see-through or significantly thinner than expected due to excessive squish.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too Low)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too low, causing the nozzle to be too close to the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text states that a transparent or extremely thin first layer is a symptom of the nozzle being too close.
properties.when_false_rationale: The absence of a transparent/thin first layer makes 'nozzle too close' less likely, but other symptoms like 'no extrusion' could still indicate it, according to the text.

source.name: Extrusion Too Wide
source.description: Deposited plastic lines on the first layer are significantly wider than the configured extrusion width, spreading out excessively.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too Low)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too low, causing the nozzle to be too close to the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text lists excessively wide extrusion as a symptom of the nozzle being too close.
properties.when_false_rationale: If the extrusion width is normal, it makes 'nozzle too close' less likely based on the symptoms described in the text, although other symptoms might still be present.

source.name: Nozzle Scratching Sound
source.description: An audible scratching noise occurs as the nozzle travels across the print bed or previous layers, indicating it is too close.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too Low)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too low, causing the nozzle to be too close to the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text mentions that a scratching sound may occur when the nozzle is too close.
properties.when_false_rationale: The text indicates scratching 'may' occur, so its absence does not rule out or strongly argue against the nozzle being too close.

source.name: Poor Inter-Layer Adhesion/Gaps
source.description: Layers above the first do not bond well together, potentially showing gaps between them or being easily separated.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too Low)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too low, causing the nozzle to be too close to the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text states that poor adhesion or gaps in subsequent layers can result from the nozzle being too close.
properties.when_false_rationale: Good inter-layer adhesion makes 'nozzle too close' less likely according to the text, but first-layer specific symptoms could still indicate the issue.

source.name: Curved/Inconsistent Extrusion
source.description: Filament extruded freely in mid-air comes out crooked, curled, or unevenly instead of falling straight down, often indicating a partial blockage.

target.name: Nozzle Blockage (Partial)
target.description: Flow of filament through the nozzle is restricted but not completely stopped, often caused by debris or heat creep.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text suggests checking for curved or inconsistent extrusion as an indicator of a blocked nozzle.
properties.when_false_rationale: Straight extrusion suggests the nozzle is not partially blocked, according to the diagnostic check described in the text.

source.name: Extruded Diameter Mismatch
source.description: The diameter of the filament extruded in mid-air appears inconsistent or does not match the expected nozzle diameter.

target.name: Nozzle Blockage (Partial)
target.description: Flow of filament through the nozzle is restricted but not completely stopped, often caused by debris or heat creep.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text implies checking if the extruded diameter matches the nozzle size is a way to diagnose blockage, suggesting a mismatch indicates a (partial) blockage.
properties.when_false_rationale: If the extruded diameter matches the nozzle size, it suggests the nozzle is likely not partially blocked, based on the diagnostic check described.

source.name: Extruder Clicking/Skipping
source.description: Audible clicking or thumping sounds from the extruder motor, indicating it is struggling and failing to push filament consistently, often due to excessive resistance.

target.name: Nozzle Blockage (Partial)
target.description: Flow of filament through the nozzle is restricted but not completely stopped, often caused by debris or heat creep.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text lists extruder clicking/skipping as an indicator ('Listen for clicking sounds') of a blocked nozzle causing resistance.
properties.when_false_rationale: The absence of clicking doesn't rule out a partial blockage according to the text, as a minor blockage might not cause enough resistance to make the extruder skip.

source.name: Extruder Clicking/Skipping
source.description: Audible clicking or thumping sounds from the extruder motor, indicating it is struggling and failing to push filament consistently, often due to excessive resistance.

target.name: Nozzle Blockage (Complete)
target.description: Flow of filament through the nozzle is entirely prevented.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text links extruder clicking/skipping to nozzle blockage in general ('Listen for clicking sounds'), which includes complete blockage causing high resistance.
properties.when_false_rationale: The absence of clicking/skipping suggests less resistance, making a complete blockage less likely according to the text, although not impossible.

source.name: No Extrusion
source.description: No filament is extruded from the nozzle despite the extruder motor attempting to push filament.

target.name: Nozzle Blockage (Complete)
target.description: Flow of filament through the nozzle is entirely prevented.

properties.when_true_rationale: No extrusion is a primary symptom of a complete nozzle blockage, although the text also mentions it can occur in extreme cases of the nozzle being too close ('In extreme cases, no plastic will come out at all').
properties.when_false_rationale: If any filament is extruding, the nozzle cannot be completely blocked, based on the definition of complete blockage.

source.name: First Layer Rounded/Rope-like
source.description: The initial layer's extruded lines are rounded on top, resembling ropes, instead of being squished flat against the bed.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too High)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too high, causing the nozzle to be too far from the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text states that a rounded or rope-like first layer is a symptom of the nozzle being too far from the bed.
properties.when_false_rationale: A flat first layer indicates sufficient squish, suggesting the nozzle is not too high based on the description in the text.

source.name: Poor Bed Adhesion
source.description: The first layer does not stick properly to the print surface, potentially detaching completely or being easily knocked loose.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too High)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too high, causing the nozzle to be too far from the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text lists poor bed adhesion as a symptom when the nozzle is too far, but also lists other potential causes (contamination, leveling, temp).
properties.when_false_rationale: Good bed adhesion makes 'nozzle too high' less likely as a cause according to the text, but other symptoms like rounded lines could still indicate the issue.

source.name: Gaps Between First Layer Lines
source.description: Noticeable spaces exist between adjacent lines on the first layer because they are not squished together sufficiently.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too High)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too high, causing the nozzle to be too far from the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text states that visible gaps between first layer lines are a symptom of the nozzle being too far.
properties.when_false_rationale: The absence of gaps makes 'nozzle too high' less likely based on the text, but lines could still be rounded without gaps.

source.name: Printed Lines Thin (Insufficient Squish)
source.description: Extruded lines appear narrow or do not merge properly side-by-side due to insufficient squish from the nozzle being too far.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too High)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too high, causing the nozzle to be too far from the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text mentions that lines appearing thinner than expected is a symptom of the nozzle being too far.
properties.when_false_rationale: If printed lines are not thinner than expected, it suggests the nozzle is not too high, according to the symptoms listed in the text.

source.name: Print Warping/Detaching
source.description: The print lifts off the print bed at the corners or edges, or detaches completely during the printing process, often due to poor first layer adhesion or thermal stress.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too High)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too high, causing the nozzle to be too far from the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text lists print warping or detaching as a potential consequence ('may warp or detach') of the nozzle being too far, often due to poor adhesion.
properties.when_false_rationale: The absence of warping doesn't rule out the nozzle being too high according to the text, as other symptoms might exist or the print might not be prone to warping.

source.name: Poor Inter-Layer Adhesion/Gaps
source.description: Layers above the first do not bond well together, potentially showing gaps between them or being easily separated.

target.name: Incorrect Z-Offset (Too High)
target.description: The printer's Z-axis offset is calibrated too high, causing the nozzle to be too far from the print bed for the first layer.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text states that poor layer bonding in subsequent layers can result from the nozzle being too far.
properties.when_false_rationale: Good layer bonding makes 'nozzle too high' less likely based on the text, but first-layer specific symptoms could still indicate the issue.

source.name: Poor Bed Adhesion
source.description: The first layer does not stick properly to the print surface, potentially detaching completely or being easily knocked loose.

target.name: Contaminated Print Surface
target.description: The print bed surface is dirty (e.g., dust, oil, fingerprints), preventing proper filament adhesion.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text implies cleaning the bed (Quick Fix 2) addresses adhesion issues, suggesting contamination can cause poor adhesion.
properties.when_false_rationale: Good bed adhesion suggests the print surface is likely not significantly contaminated, based on the implication in the text's quick fixes.

source.name: Poor Bed Adhesion
source.description: The first layer does not stick properly to the print surface, potentially detaching completely or being easily knocked loose.

target.name: Incorrect Bed Leveling
target.description: The print bed is not uniformly level or trammed relative to the nozzle's travel plane, causing inconsistent first layer height.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text implies checking bed leveling (Quick Fix 3) addresses adhesion issues, suggesting incorrect leveling can cause poor adhesion.
properties.when_false_rationale: Good bed adhesion suggests the bed leveling is likely adequate, based on the implication in the text's quick fixes.

source.name: Poor Bed Adhesion
source.description: The first layer does not stick properly to the print surface, potentially detaching completely or being easily knocked loose.

target.name: Incorrect Bed Temperature
target.description: The print bed temperature is set incorrectly (too low or too high) for the specific filament type, negatively affecting first layer adhesion.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text implies verifying bed temperature (Quick Fix 4) addresses adhesion issues, suggesting incorrect temperature can cause poor adhesion.
properties.when_false_rationale: Good bed adhesion suggests the bed temperature is likely appropriate for the filament, based on the implication in the text's quick fixes.

source.name: Print Warping/Detaching
source.description: The print lifts off the print bed at the corners or edges, or detaches completely during the printing process, often due to poor first layer adhesion or thermal stress.

target.name: Incorrect Bed Temperature
target.description: The print bed temperature is set incorrectly (too low or too high) for the specific filament type, negatively affecting first layer adhesion.

properties.when_true_rationale: The text implies incorrect bed temperature can affect adhesion (Quick Fix 4) and the observation description mentions thermal stress, suggesting a link to warping/detaching.
properties.when_false_rationale: The absence of warping doesn't rule out incorrect bed temperature according to the text, as other factors influence warping and adhesion.
